CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 23, 1962, pg. 1, reads: "Boys Found Body of Nurse - These boys, aged 11, 10 and 9 years, respectively, found the body of Mavis Todd, the murdered nurse, down in dark vale (seen in the background, off Homestead-Duquesne Road), when they sought to retrieve a thrown ball. - Harris Photo." Portion of accompanying article reads: "W. Mifflin Man Admits Slaying - Cement Worker Bludgeons Nurse; Hides Her Body - Clarence Mitchell, 28, of 3715 Homestead Ave., West Mifflin, confessed to the brutal slaying of Mavis Todd, 20, nurses aide of West Mifflin..."
TitMainTitle: Sherril Todd, Myrtle Todd, and three boys, standing on dirt road to left of Homestead-Duquesne Road, site of murder of Mavis Todd, West Mifflin
